page.title: 04Horningsham Village School
page.content: In the {School}at present there are thirty-four children aged from four to eleven. Most of the children come from the Village itself although there is one family from Crockerton and one from Warminster. The children are divided into two classes; one infant and one junior. There is a Headmaster, an assistant teacher, two cooks, one cleaner, one lunch supervisor and a secretary. The School is very well equipped with two BBC Model B Computers with Disk Drives and a printer. There is a Colour Television, a Video Recorder and a Hi-Fi System for the playing of tepes and records. The School also has a large Library. There is a great deal of land attached to the School including a field, wild area, an orchard and a playground. There is soon to be an Adventure Playground.
